Heading back to Pittsburgh after a quick trip to DC to support H.R. 748, the CARES Act. This bill is an important step to save lives and support families during the #CoronaOutbreak ‚Äì although much more must be done.

Our healthcare workers and first responders are working tirelessly to save lives ‚Äì and they need personal protective equipment to keep fighting the #CoronaOutbreak. We need the #DefenseProductionActNOW to end the supply shortage. https://t.co/FjMpeQk4K0

It also helps our health care providers and state and local civil servants who are working to battle the #CoronaOutbreak on the frontlines. Congress must do more ‚Äì but this bill is an important step in the right direction, and I strongly support it. https://t.co/u3X32CGpTp

I supported H.R. 748, the CARES Act, as it passed the House today. I believe this bill, while imperfect, provides the crucial assistance millions of Americans need during the #CoronaOutbreak. It expands unemployment compensation and provides direct payments to most Americans.
This bill is not the answer to all our #CoronaOutbreak problems ‚Äì but it is a good start. We must continue to work hard to protect our public health and economy.

It would allocate $375 billion for small businesses. It would also provide $150 billion for hospitals and health care providers and $16 billion for essential medical supplies to help our strained health care providers.

This bill would expand unemployment insurance to part-time workers, self-employed individuals, and contractors. It would also provide direct cash payments to most Americans, including those who receive Social Security benefits.

Today, the House is considering an economic relief package that will help to support families and save lives during the #CoronaOutbreak. I am eager to get this bill passed ‚Äì and to get crucial assistance to Americans quickly.

If you are unable to work due to the COVID-19 outbreak, you can apply for assistance with the Pennsylvania Office of Unemployment Compensation. For more information on what you‚Äôll need and how to get started, visit https://t.co/Y0z25Vm4DN.

More than 400,000 Pennsylvanians filed for unemployment last week due to the #CoronaOutbreak. I believe it‚Äôs the government‚Äôs responsibility to ensure Americans put out of work during this pandemic have the support they need. https://t.co/IevltAaIn7

As @HouseDemocrats take up the stimulus package, I will continue to consider every provision based on how it impacts the families, workers, and small businesses in #PGH.  Saving lives and supporting families are my top priorities during the #CoronaOutbreak.

We must continue to work for the best deal for hardworking Americans and their families. It continues to be my top priority to do much more for struggling households during the #CoronaOutbreak.

It would provide help for most American households and small businesses through the economic downturn ‚Äì including expanded unemployment benefits and direct cash payments ‚Äì as well as funding for coronavirus-related health care and personal protective gear for frontline workers.
